content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is perfect challenging clash that can be solved quickly.
This is an to solve problem however I think the description to calculate exterior angle e is not clear enough. But that eventually makes this clash more challenging. Good one.

I think there are a few problem in this clash. First is giving the formula. I think you need to explain how to get this formula, and let people found it.

Also, the fact that the angle should always be an integer could make people solve all the case and just did a memo thing.
that's a so good clash

Hi @Invisible_person and thanks for your Contribution !
-> I have to say that's a good idea,
-> i appreciate you give the formulae !
=> I've upvoted for you :-).

Maybe, you could split the 3 phrases in the goal into 3 paragraphes ?
-> it would be clearer.

I'd like to suggest you to add also classical and well-known (or Named) polygons such as Rectangle (n = 4), Hexagon (n = 6), Heptagone and so on ...
Good clash !
Good problem for the fastest version of clash.

Overall
* Currently the clash is only about implementing simple formulas in code. Please add at least one programming element to the clash, e.g. loops, conditions, lists/arrays.

Constraints
* Please mention that [[n]] is chosen such that the angles to output are always integers and never require any rounding.

Thanks.

I tried my best to find a better way to make it programming related but found none. It's late, my head is a little cloudy so I'll try tomorrow, but tell me if this current one is ok. I also didn't know what to put around the even and odd, [[]], {{}}, or <<>>?
I wanted to make it simple, for beginners (like me).

PS : you suggest in Contraints "0 < n < 40" ...
-> what about n = 1 and n = 2 ;-) ?
(maybe you can update it)
I know it will give it a twist, but I'm lazy soooo..........

I can make it 3 lines in Python [:-) ]:

n=int(input())
print((n - 2) * 180 // n, 360 // n)
print('even' if 360 // n % 2 == 0 else 'odd')
I changed it to 3 paragraphs like suggested, but I think most people knows how many sides a pentagon or rectangles have... But I did say most.
Thanks.

"even" and "odd" are not variable names. They may be considered constants, so {{}}.

The current one is ok! However, the issue now is that only Test 3 requires the output of "odd". Maybe change the input of Validator 3 to 8 instead?

Thanks.
Updated!
